t: Psalm 73
A Psalm of Asaph.
Truly*p God is good to Israel, even to such as are of a clean heart.
But*p as for me, my feet were almost gone; my steps had well nigh slipped.
For*p I was envious at the foolish, when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
For*p there are no bands in their death: but their strength is firm.
They*p are not in trouble as other men; neither are they plagued like other men.
Therefore*p pride compasseth them about as a chain; violence covereth them as a garment.
Their*p eyes stand out with fatness: they have more than heart could wish.
They*p are corrupt, and speak wickedly concerning oppression: they speak loftily.
They*p set their mouth against the heavens, and their tongue walketh through the earth.
Therefore*p his people return hither: and waters of a full cup are wrung out to them.
And*p they say, How doth God know? and is there knowledge in the most High?
Behold,*p these are the ungodly, who prosper in the world; they increase in riches.
Verily*p I have cleansed my heart in vain, and washed my hands in innocency.
For*p all the day long have I been plagued, and chastened every morning.
If*p I say, I will speak thus; behold, I should offend against the generation of thy children.
When*p I thought to know this, it was too painful for me;
Until*p I went into the sanctuary of God; then understood I their end.
Surely*p thou didst set them in slippery places: thou castedst them down into destruction.
How*p are they brought into desolation, as in a moment! they are utterly consumed with terrors.
As*p a dream when one awaketh; so, O Lord, when thou awakest, thou shalt despise their image.
Thus*p my heart was grieved, and I was pricked in my reins.
So*p foolish was I, and ignorant: I was as a beast before thee.
Nevertheless*p I am continually with thee: thou hast holden me by my right hand.
Thou*p shalt guide me with thy counsel, and afterward receive me to glory.
Whom*p have I in heaven but thee? and there is none upon earth that I desire beside thee.
My*p flesh and my heart faileth: but God is the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.
For,*p lo, they that are far from thee shall perish: thou hast destroyed all them that go a whoring from thee.
But*p it is good for me to draw near to God: I have put my trust in the Lord God,*s that I may declare all thy works.
